comment.author: 65669741@N08
comment._content:
Koree in the foreground,

The large one at the left is either of the twins Kuttabul or Koompartoo

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/65669741@N08] Thanks for the info. When you consider that it is clear what wharves these ferries are stopping at in the photographs, you can conclude which ones they may be by a process of elimination. Is that how you were able to identify them? Thanks again MV Baragoola.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 65669741@N08
comment._content: Koree's name plat is visible - as for the other one only two (twin) vessels looked like that (at a distance though they are indistinguishable)

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/65669741@N08] Thanks for your expert knowledge! We've added these details to our records.
